section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Second House:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By the Grace of the Divine Guru, one meets the Lord.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By the Grace of the Divine Guru, one is carried across to the other side.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

translation.text: By the Grace of the Divine Guru, one swims across to heaven.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By the Grace of the Divine Guru, one remains dead while yet alive. ||1||

text: ਸਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: True, True, True True, True is the Divine Guru.

transliteration.text: sat sat sat sat sat guradēv .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. text: ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਆਨ ਸਭ ਸੇਵ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: False, false, false, false is all other service. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jhūth jhūth jhūth jhūth ān sabh sēv .1. rahāu .

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is implanted within.

text: ਜਉ ਗੁਰਦੇਉ ਨ ਦਹ ਦਿਸ ਧਾਵੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one does not wander in the ten directions.

transliteration.text: jau guradēu n dah dis dhāvai .

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one's bed is lifted up out of the water. ||6||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one has bathed at the sixty-eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage.

text: ਜਉ ਗੁਰਦੇਉ ਤ ਜਮ ਤੇ ਛੂਟੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one escapes from the Messenger of Death.

transliteration.text: jau guradēu t jam tē shūtai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. text: ਜਉ ਗੁਰਦੇਉ ਤ ਜਨਮਿ ਨ ਮਰੈ ॥੮॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one is not subject to the cycle of reincarnation. ||8||

transliteration.text: jau guradēu t janam n marai .8.
